title: Map projection
summary: In cartography, a map projection is any of a broad set of  transformations employed to represent the curved two-dimensional surface of a globe on a plane.[1][2][3] In a map projection, coordinates, often expressed as latitude and longitude, of locations from the surface of the globe are transformed to coordinates on a plane.[4][5] Projection is a necessary step in creating a two-dimensional map and is one of the essential elements of cartography.
